thread.title: Don Mattingly out as Dodgers manager
thread.title_full: Don Mattingly out as Dodgers manager | New York Post

author: Jonathan Lehman
title: Don Mattingly out as Dodgers manager
text:
Don is gone.
The Dodgers are getting rid of manager Don Mattingly , according to CBSSports.com, which gently described the break-up as a mutual decision.
ESPN reported the Dodgers offered Mattingly a contract extension this weekend — he had one year remaining on his deal — though as Fox Sports points out, that could be seen as a hollow offer if it did not cover his coaching staff.
The legendary Yankees first baseman posted five consecutive winning seasons on the Dodgers bench and claimed the past three division titles, but early playoff exits became underwhelming for a team carrying a record payroll north of $300 million.
This year, the Dodgers were bounced in Game 5 of the Division Series by the Mets.
Dodgers president Andrew Friedman didn’t hire Mattingly, and now will look to bring in a hand-picked ally. Mattingly will garner interest from the Marlins, according to the report, for their managerial opening.
